text: <@U040U4D0LAX> you need to search for those files specified there, what they are doing. From the picture I guess it's a facebook analytics/tracker and another JS file. I am currently working on a similar topic. My best solution would be to load specific JS files for specific contents, which is a lot of manual writing. Of course check for what are these files being used and if you really need them, because if you don't... remove them from your code.
<@U040T94AZLY> these are loading direct from HubSpot when I connect Facebook page with HubSpot I dont have controls on this to load or not or can add delay
There is a way of loading Javascript files later - called lazy loading Javascript files. But it's a bit more complex to achieve. In the end it should work similarly like lazy loading some images.
